docs.lead_paragraph: Hospitals and medical practices across the United States braced for confusion and administrative hassles as new insurance plans under President Barack Obama's healthcare law took effect on Wednesday.

headline.main: Doctors, Hospitals Expect Some Confusion as Obamacare Plans Start
headline.print_headline: Doctors, Hospitals Expect Some Confusion as Obamacare Plans Start

docs.snippet: Hospitals and medical practices across the United States braced for confusion and administrative hassles as new insurance plans under President Barack Obama's healthcare law took effect on Wednesday.

headline.main: Shorter Workweeks Are Likely in New Year

docs.abstract: More employees are likely to be working shorter workweeks in 2014, as government policies nudge them and employers in that direction, an economist writes.
docs.snippet: More employees are likely to be working shorter workweeks in 2014, as government policies nudge them and employers in that direction, an economist writes.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Justice Sonia Sotomayor is giving the government until Friday morning to respond to her decision on President Obama’s health care law.

headline.main: Justice Blocks Contraception Mandate on Insurance in Suit by Nuns
headline.print_headline: Justice Blocks Contraception Mandate on Insurance in Suit by Nuns

docs.abstract: Supreme Court Justice Sonia Sotomayor temporarily blocks the Obama administration from forcing some religious-affiliated groups to provide health insurance coverage of birth control or face penalties as part of the Affordable Care Act; acting at the request of an order of nuns in Colorado, Justice Sotomayor issues the stay just hours before the requirement was to go into effect.
docs.snippet: Justice Sonia Sotomayor is giving the government until Friday morning to respond to her decision on President Obama’s health care law.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

byline.original: By STEVE KENNY and ROBERT PEAR

docs.lead_paragraph: The new moment will test the health law’s central premise — that extending coverage to far more Americans will improve the nation’s health and help many avoid crippling medical bills.

headline.main: Millions Gaining Health Coverage Under Law
headline.print_headline: Millions Gaining Health Coverage Today Under Law

docs.abstract: Millions of Americans will begin receiving health insurance coverage under the health care reform law as of January 1 after years of contention and a rollout hobbled by delays and technical problems; new moment in effort to overhaul country's health care system will test idea that extending coverage to far more Americans will improve nation's health and help many avoid crippling medical bills.
docs.snippet: The new moment will test the health law’s central premise — that extending coverage to far more Americans will improve the nation’s health and help many avoid crippling medical bills.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

byline.original: By ROBERT PEAR and ABBY GOODNOUGH

docs.lead_paragraph: Now that Obamacare has finally arrived, liberals can stop defending its flaws and argue instead for universal health care.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by documentary filmmaker Michael Moore concludes that the health care reform law is awful and urges liberals to fight for universal health care.
docs.snippet: Now that Obamacare has finally arrived, liberals can stop defending its flaws and argue instead for universal health care.

docs.lead_paragraph: The state seeks to suspend same-sex unions that became legal when a federal judge struck down the state’s voter-approved ban.

headline.main: Utah Asks Highest Court to Suspend Gay Marriage
headline.print_headline: Utah Asks Highest Court To Suspend Gay Marriage

docs.abstract: Leaders in socially conservative Utah are asking United States Supreme Court to suspend same-sex unions that became legal when a federal judge struck down the state’s voter-approved ban; say state will suffer serious harm as same-sex marriages continue in county courthouses and government buildings across the state.
docs.snippet: The state seeks to suspend same-sex unions that became legal when a federal judge struck down the state’s voter-approved ban.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
